definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: The government decapitalized industry and commerce with harsh tax policies.
sentences.chinese: 该政府通过苛刻的税收政策从工商界抽取资本。

sentences.english: I have been in the business for the last ten years， and worked as the superintendent in the personnel department。
sentences.chinese: 本人在过去十年在商界担任人事部主任迄今。

sentences.english: First, one can listen to what businesspeople say.
sentences.chinese: 首先，你可以去听听工商界人士怎么说。

sentences.english: The company established itself firmly in business.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司已在商界牢固地确立了自己的地位。

sentences.english: The business lobby pushed back, and Canada-China relations were chilled.
sentences.chinese: 结果商界游说团反扑，加中关系冷却。

sentences.english: Besides, the two Prime Ministers also jointly met with representatives from the Czech business community on the evening of December 8.
sentences.chinese: 此外，两国总理8日晚还共同会见了捷克工商界代表。

sentences.english: Jin merchant and Hui merchant are two business groups in Ming and Qing Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 晋商与徽商是活跃于明清商界的两大劲旅。

sentences.english: It is poignant to think that one of the most lauded businessmen of a generation should be racked by regret.
sentences.chinese: 想到这代人中广受称赞的一位商界人士遗憾万千。

sentences.english: Thailand businessman Shi Li Hua , is the celebrity owning hundreds of millions assets on commercial circles.
sentences.chinese: 泰国商人施利华，是商界上拥有亿万资产的风云人物。

sentences.english: He is the leader of the pro-business Free Democratic Party, which strongly supports nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 他是商界自由民主党的领导人，强烈支持使用核能。

sentences.english: Lately, China has been showing the business world the business end of its economic cudgel.
sentences.chinese: 最近中国就在向商界展示其经济大棒的商业端。

sentences.english: Suspicion towards Mr Tsang remains strong in business and political quarters, particularly in the pro-Beijing camp.
sentences.chinese: 政商界对曾荫权并不信任，尤其是左派。

sentences.english: There were also over 500 businesspersons attending the Forum.
sentences.chinese: 两国工商界共500多人参加了论坛。

sentences.english: People in political circles and business circles spend much time on clothing, they have good manners.
sentences.chinese: 政界和工商界人士普遍衣饰讲究，言行举止规矩大方。

sentences.english: About 800 participants from the Asian and European business communities attended the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 来自亚洲和欧洲约800名工商界人士出席开幕式。

sentences.english: Many of the people who ring the bell are business executives whose companies trade on the exchange.
sentences.chinese: 许多敲钟的人是商界高管，他们公司的股票在此交易。

definition: the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
lit. big crocodile/fig. major figure/big shot/top boss (esp. criminal)
Monopoly (game)/known as 大富翁[Da4 fu4 weng1] in PRC
dark road/criminal ways/the underworld/see also 白道[bai2 dao4]
